website_summaries.verdict: This soccer cleat has earned a good feedback for its accurate sizing. Most of its users love its fit, which at the same time has also provided them excellent comfort. These two factors are very important when handing the ball. However, there are a few who were not satisfied with the material used more specifically on the outsole of the cleat. The red metallic paint that easily chips off has disappointed these users. Overall, many players are still with this soccer cleat, most specially those with wide feet.
pros: A good number of reviewers expressed how they love the fit and accurate sizing of these soccer cleats
The flexibility of this soccer cleat’s materials is good said a certain user
Most buyers with wide feet were happy to find this boots for the firm ground
Many users attested to the comfortable fit of these New Balance cleats
A few testers loved the design of this version of the Furon
A handful of customers appreciate the good quality of these soccer cleats
cons: According to a specific buyer, this soccer cleat is highly priced for its quality
He also added that the cleat was only used for two weeks of practices and its sole already gave up
Some reviewers said the red metallic bottom part of this soccer cleat easily chipped off and left marks on the floor

customer_reviews.title: Great, but the red bottoms leave red scuff marks on tile floors
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son to play soccer. So far, (2 weeks), he loves them. The size was correct; the fit is good. Some others have been too narrow at the toe end; so far, I haven't heard that complaint from him. He loves the red bottoms, although the color has begun to come off as he walks on my tile floor (I tell him not to but, he is only 9- it's going to happen). So far, no complaints (other than the red marks on the tile). I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: bbm

customer_reviews.title: but they fit great. I wish they came in mor subtle colors
customer_reviews.text: One of the few soccer cleats you can buy that come in wider sizes. Hard to get on, but they fit great. I wish they came in mor subtle colors, but so far very comfortable

customer_reviews.title: Not wide at all, Furon version 3.0 is wide, Version 4.0 is definitely not.
customer_reviews.text: Impossible to get on as there's no separation between the tongue and the shoe sides. The one time my son squeezed them on, they were VERY narrow, especially for a shoe marked as "Wide". Do not recommend if looking for wide cleats.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rubber in back very hard
customer_reviews.text: the material that the shoes are made of is very hard so makes for a hard break-in, after 3 times playing soccer and leaving with blisters, all three times, I gave up. My foot aren't thin and that's why I got the Wide size, which isn't so Wide.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Showalter

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Narrow boot that takes a long time to properly brake in. Very thin- tore across the top when another player step on my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great fit.
customer_reviews.text: Son loves the wide cleats. He says it’s his best pair.

customer_reviews.title: Had durability issues
customer_reviews.text: Nice and light, fit well on the foot but had some blister issues on my Achilles at the top of the heel. Then just when that was broken in the top of the toe tore open.
